place.name: SAXBY
place.gazetteerText: SAXBY, a parish in the district and county of Lincoln; on the river Ancholme, 5½ miles W N W of Wicken-by r. station, and 7 S W by W of Market-Rasen. Post-town, Spridlington, under Market-Rasen. Acres, 2, 322. Real property, £1, 581. Pop., 112. Houses, 23. The manor belongs to the Earl of Scarborough. The living is a vicarage, united with Firsby, in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £96.* Patron, the Earl of Scarborough. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

place.name: SAXBY ALL SAINTS
place.gazetteerText: Saxby by Barton on Humber, par. and vil., Lincolnshire - par., 2322 ac., pop. 327; vil., 4 miles SW. of Barton upon Humber; P.O., called Saxby All Saints. (In 1887, John Bartholomew's Gazetteer of the British Isles)
